[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Struct: ModuleInfo] [Integer Overflow] The size field is usize and expansion_size is u64 - on 32-bit systems, could size values overflow when cast from u64 file sizes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Struct: ModuleInfo] [Arithmetic Overflow] When comparing or aggregating size and expansion_size values, could arithmetic operations overflow without checked_* variants? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Struct: ModuleInfo] [Derive Clone Safety] The #[derive(Clone)] on line 56 - does cloning ModuleInfo with very large size values cause excessive memory allocation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Overall Architecture] [Privilege Escalation] If this tool runs with elevated privileges (e.g., as part of a validator setup), can an attacker use path traversal to read/write sensitive system files? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Overall Architecture] [Side Channel] Does the timing of deserialize() or check_module_complexity() leak information about module contents that could be exploited in cryptographic contexts? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Overall Architecture] [Signal Handling] Does the async runtime properly handle signals (SIGINT, SIGTERM) to ensure graceful shutdown and prevent corrupt CSV output? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Overall Architecture] [Temp File Security] Should the CSV be written atomically to a temp file first, or could system crashes during write leave corrupt partial files? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Overall Architecture] [Dependency Vulnerabilities] Does the move_binary_format crate have known deserialization vulnerabilities that could be exploited through this tool? (High)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Overall Architecture] [Sandboxing] Should this tool run in a sandbox (containers, seccomp) when processing untrusted modules to limit blast radius of exploits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Bytecode Gadgets] Can an attacker craft bytecode that contains ROP-style gadgets exploitable if deserialize() or complexity checking has memory corruption bugs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Recursive Type Definitions] Can malicious modules contain recursive or mutually-recursive type definitions that cause infinite loops or stack overflows in check_module_complexity()? (High)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Signature Table Overflow] Can crafted signature tables in the module bytecode cause integer overflows when computing sizes during deserialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Constant Pool Bomb] Can an attacker create a module with an enormous constant pool that causes memory exhaustion during deserialize() before validation occurs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Function Table Manipulation] Can oversized function tables in the bytecode cause unbounded iteration or memory allocation in check_module_complexity()? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Field Definition Overflow] Can excessive field definitions in struct types cause integer overflow when calculating memory layout during complexity checking? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Instruction Sequence Bomb] Can specially crafted instruction sequences cause exponential complexity in the check_module_complexity() analysis? (High)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: read_modules()] [Async Task Leak] If an error occurs in join_all(), are all pending async file reads properly cancelled, or could tasks leak and hold file handles? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: read_modules()] [Future Cancellation Safety] Are the async file read futures cancellation-safe, or could cancellation mid-read leave the filesystem in an inconsistent state? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info()] [Work Stealing Interference] Can rayon's work stealing cause cache thrashing or NUMA issues when processing large modules across CPU cores? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info()] [Thread Pool Exhaustion] Does rayon share its thread pool globally, and could processing modules in this tool starve other rayon users in the same process? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Expansion Size Overflow] The u64::MAX parameter to check_module_complexity() - can the actual expansion_size exceed u64::MAX causing silent overflow and incorrect reporting? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: extract_module_info_single()] [Size Calculation Overflow] The bytes.len() returns usize - on platforms where usize < u64, could very large files cause truncation when stored as size? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: render_data_csv()] [Display Overflow] When formatting u64 values as strings for CSV, could values near u64::MAX cause buffer overflows in the formatting code? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: list_files_with_extension()] [Directory Enumeration Race] Between enumerating directory entries and checking is_file()/is_dir(), can files be deleted causing spurious errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/tools/compute-module-expansion-size/src/main.rs] [Function: read_modules()] [File Modification Race] Between listing .mv files and reading them, can an attacker modify file contents to inject malicious bytecode? (Medium)
